title: Ohm's Law Circuit Simulator
description: An interactive circuit simulator demonstrating Ohm's Law (V = IR) with animated current flow, adjustable voltage and resistance sliders, real-time calculations, and overload warnings.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Physics
Electronics
Electrical Engineering
learningObjectives: State and apply Ohm's Law formula (V = IR)
Explain the direct relationship between voltage and current
Explain the inverse relationship between resistance and current
Calculate current given voltage and resistance values
Predict how changing circuit parameters affects current
prerequisites: Familiarity with voltage, current, and resistance units

controls.name: Voltage
controls.description: Adjusts the battery voltage in the circuit

controls.name: Resistance
controls.description: Adjusts the resistor value in the circuit

controls.name: Reset
controls.description: Resets all parameters to default values

controls.name: Show Equation
controls.description: Toggles display of the V = IR equation

visualElements.name: Battery
visualElements.description: Standard battery symbol with voltage label

visualElements.name: Resistor
visualElements.description: Zigzag symbol that changes color based on current (blue=cold, red=hot)

visualElements.name: Ammeter
visualElements.description: Circle display showing current value, flashes red on overload

visualElements.name: Current Flow Animation
visualElements.description: Yellow particles moving through circuit at speed proportional to current
